page.title: 02VILLAGES IN SUFFOLK
page.content: The area we agreed to survey covers the two villages of Chevington and Hargrave and the hamlet of Knowles Green, surrouned mainly by arable farms. The largest of the two villages is Chevington approx. pop. 600. At least 50% of the housing, ranging from large detached houses to small terraced bungalows, were built in the last 20 years. Consquently the population has become younger with a thriving village shcool with a register of 57 pupils aged 5 to 9. The social life of the village centres around the Village Hall with activities from Playgroup for the under 5's, the Womens Institute and the Good Companions (over 60's) Club. All ages being catered for. Although the majority of the land surrouding Chevington is arable. we do ave a dairy herd at Factory Farm.....
